knowledge.heading: Ritual as Reality Control
knowledge.description: The text demonstrates how personal rituals and repetitive behaviors can become attempts to control an uncontrollable world. These ritualized actions provide psychological comfort but also reveal the desperate need to impose order on chaos.
knowledge.pattern_connection: The insular perspective transforms ordinary actions into protective rituals, using repetition to show how damaged psyches create meaning through compulsive patterns.

device_examples.quote: the crack in the sidewalk that looked
device_examples.effect: Transforms ordinary objects into meaningful markers that represent the ritualized navigation of a hostile world.

device_examples.quote: A change was coming, and nobody knew it but me
device_examples.effect: Shows how ritual thinking creates false sense of control and prediction over unpredictable reality.
